    HYP: raising rates in this difficult economic background could be risky and could affect the question of `` whether this time is different , '' said Deutsche .

  1155. REF: 'Sonogenetics ' allows brain cells to be controlled by sound waves

    HYP: `` Sonogenetika '' or control of brain cells using sound waves


  1156. REF: the video shows how the nematodes change direction the moment they are blasted with sonic pulses .

    HYP: this video shows how sound impulses affect the direction in which the nematodes .


  1157. REF: scientists have bred worms with genetically modified nervous systems that can be controlled by bursts of sound waves .

    HYP: the scientists raised worms with genetically modified neural system that can control the sound waves .


  1158. REF: the tiny nematodes change direction the moment they are blasted with sonic pulses that are too high-pitched for humans to hear .

    HYP: tiny nematode changes direction at a time when they are affected by the acoustic pulses that are inaudible to the human ear .


  1159. REF: the pulses work by switching on motor neuron cells that are genetically modified to carry membrane channels that respond to ultrasonic waves .

    HYP: the pulses are working so that they switch cells genetically modified motor neurons , which are programmed to respond to these ultrasonic waves .


  1160. REF: related : researchers read and write brain activity with light

    HYP: related : scientists can read and write brain activity using light


  1161. REF: researchers said the worms demonstrate the power of a new procedure , dubbed sonogenetics , in which ultrasound can be used to activate a range of brain , heart and muscle cells from outside the body .

    HYP: the scientists said that these worms are a great example of a new methodology called sonogenetika that uses ultrasound to activate the brain , heart and muscle cells and activates the outside of the body .


  1162. REF: Sreekanth Chalasani , a researcher at the Salk Institute in La Jolla , California , told the Guardian that the procedure could one day replace deep-brain stimulation , an invasive procedure that delivers electrical pulses into people 's brains to treat symptoms of Parkinson 's disease .

    HYP: Sreekanth Chalasani , a researcher from the Salk Institute in La Jolla , California said to The Guardian that this method could one day replace the deep brain stimulation - an invasive procedure , in which they are added to the patient 's brain electrodes that stimulate the brain , for example , the method is used to treat the symptoms of Parkinson 's disease .


  1163. REF: nematode worms do not usually react to ultrasound , but Chalasani found that they did when they were surrounded by a fluid containing microscopic bubbles .

    HYP: nematodes usually do not respond to the ultrasound , but Chalasani found that the reaction will be when it is placed in a liquid containing microscopic bubbles .


  1164. REF: the bubbles , he found , amplify the ultrasonic waves which then pass inside the worms .

    HYP: how he found bubbles are amplified by ultrasonic waves , which then passes through the body of worms .


  1165. REF: the amplified ultrasound waves act on structures called TRP-4 ion channels , found in the membranes of some of the worms '' cells .

    HYP: enhanced ultrasonic waves operate in ion channels TRP-4 , which is located in the membranes of some cells of the worms .


  1166. REF: the sound waves make these ion channels open up and activate the cells they are attached to , according to a report in Nature Communications .

    HYP: thanks to the acoustic waves , these channels open and activate the cells with which they are associated , reported in the journal Nature Communications .


  1167. REF: to make ultrasound-controlled nematodes , Chalasani genetically modified the worms so that some of their motor neurons carried TRP-4 ion channels .

    HYP: in order to be able to control nematodes using ultrasonic waves , Chalasani genetically modified worms so that some of their motor neurons contain ion channels TRP-4 .


  1168. REF: when he applied ultrasound to the modified creatures , the sound waves were amplified by the microbubbles and transmitted into the worms , where they switched on the modified motor neurons .

    HYP: when she used to such modified worms ultrasound , sound waves were amplified by mikrobublinami and transferred to the worms , which actuates the modified motor neurons .


  1169. REF: the procedure has some similarities with optogenetics , a groundbreaking tool that allows scientists to switch neurons on and off with pulses of light .

    HYP: the new method is much like optogenetice , groundbreaking tool that enables scientists to turn on and off neurons using light .


  1170. REF: but Chalasani said that sonogenetics could have some advantages over that technique .

    HYP: Chalasani , however , has said that sonogenetika could have many advantages compared to this technique .


  1171. REF: unlike light , which has to be sent down an optic fibre to the desired location inside the brain , low frequency ultrasound waves can pass through tissue unhindered , and so can be sent into the brain from on top of the skull .

    HYP: unlike the lights , which must be sent to the optical fibre to the desired location in the brain , ultrasonic waves can penetrate tissues without restrictions and be sent directly to the brain .


  1172. REF: `` We believe that , using gene therapy and a therapeutic virus , it may be possible to make target human neurons temporarily susceptible to the ultrasound signal in a clinical setting for certain neurological treatments , '' said Chalasani .

    HYP: `` We believe that if we use gene therapy and therapeutic viruses , we can focus on human neurons and make them temporarily sensitive to ultrasonic signals used in clinical treatment for the treatment of neurological diseases , '' Chalasani said .


  1173. REF: other applications could focus on muscle cells and insulin-producing cells , he added .

    HYP: he added that his application would also found the method for the treatment of muscle cells and cells producing insulin .

    HYP: however , it would not be Albert Einstein , even if not for this brilliantly simplified form of explanation : an hour in the vicinity of your lover seems a minute ; a minute in a hot oven , it seems an hour - and that is relativity .


  1682. REF: I have chosen ten out of his galaxy of famous quotes that enthralled me .

    HYP: I took the liberty of his whole variety of famous quotes to choose these ten , which literally mesmerized me .


  1683. REF: a clever person solves a problem . a wise person avoids it .

    HYP: intelligent people are trying to solve problems , the genius is trying to do .


  1684. REF: two things are infinite :

    HYP: only two things are infinite .


  1685. REF: the universe and human stupidity ;

    HYP: the universe and human stupidity .


  1686. REF: and I 'm not sure about the universe .

    HYP: the first one , I 'm not so sure .


  1687. REF: no amount of experimentation can ever prove me right ;

    HYP: no amount of experimentation can never prove that I was right .


  1688. REF: a single experiment can prove me wrong .

    HYP: however , the only time he can prove that I was wrong .


  1689. REF: what a sad era when it is easier to smash an atom than a prejudice .

    HYP: but it is a sad time when it is easier to split the atom than to destroy prejudices .


  1690. REF: if a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind , of what , then , is an empty desk a sign ?

    HYP: if there is a mess on the table reflects the disarray in the mind , then what reflects an empty desk ?


  1691. REF: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought , but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones .

    HYP: I do n't know what we 'll be fighting in the Third World War , but it will be in the fourth with sticks and stones .


  1692. REF: there are a thousand ways to kill time , but none to revive it .

    HYP: there are a thousand ways to kill time , but there is no way to resurrect him .


  1693. REF: a little knowledge is a dangerous thing . so is a lot .

    HYP: few know is dangerous and know a lot too .


  1694. REF: if I were given an hour in which to do a problem upon which my life depended , I would spend 40 minutes studying it , 15 minutes reviewing it and 5 minutes solving it .

    HYP: if I had an hour to tackle the problem , which would save my life , I would have spent 40 minutes of his study , 15 minutes of his analysis and his solution for 5 minutes .


  1695. REF: the hardest thing in the world to understand is income taxes .

    HYP: the hardest thing in the world to the understanding of the income tax .

    HYP: finally , I ca n't forgive myself not to declare the definition of Einstein 's formula for success : if we take A for success , the formula : a = X + Y + Z , where X is work , Y and Z rest is to keep your mouth shut .

    HYP: we did n't get an answer , and that 's why we wanted to make the quotas were removed from the final text .

    HYP: we 've been talking about it for a year and we say that this is the way .

    HYP: but to say that the quotas will solve everything ?

    HYP: not so long ago we had forty thousand , now it 's a hundred and twenty thousand .

    HYP: when it will be five hundred thousand ?

    HYP: and how we can keep those people on the territory ?

    HYP: almost no one wants to us , we just do n't know how to keep them here .

    HYP: we said : the functional hotspots , border protection , military operation .

    HYP: however , it is still too early to say whether the moderately obese people with type 2 diabetes live longer after weight loss surgery than those receiving nonsurgical treatment .

  2325. REF: weight loss operations , or bariatric surgery , use various methods to shrink the size of the stomach .

    HYP: operations for weight loss surgery bariatrické use different methods to reduce the stomach .


  2326. REF: they reduce hunger and limit the body 's ability to absorb food .

    HYP: reducing hunger and the limitations of the human body to absorb food .

    HYP: over the years , bariatrické operation proved effective for the treatment of type 2 diabetes , but most of the survey was carried out on people with morbid obesity with a body mass index ( BMI ) of 25 or higher .


  2328. REF: BMI , a measure of weight in relation to height , is considered normal between 18.5 and 24.9 .

    HYP: BMI , which measures the relationship of weight relative to height , is considered normal in the values of between 18.5 and 24.9 .


  2329. REF: a BMI of 25 or higher indicates that someone is overweight , and people with a BMI over 30 are considered obese .

    HYP: a BMI of 25 or higher is overweight people and people with a value of over 30 are considered obese .


  2330. REF: you can calculate your BMI here : 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv .

    HYP: you can calculate your BMI here : 1.usa.gov / 1D0ZqDv .


  2331. REF: for the new study , researchers from Taiwan 's Min-Sheng General Hospital used data collected since 2007 in a trial comparing two kinds of bariatric surgery - gastric bypass and sleeve gastrectomy - to medical treatments for type 2 diabetes in people who were mildly obese .

    HYP: for their new study , the researchers used the Min-Sheng General Hospital in Taiwan used data collected from a study from 2007 , which deals with two types of bariatrické surgery - gastric bypass and gastrectomy The - in medical treatments of type 3 diabetes in people who were moderately obese .


  2332. REF: the average BMI among those who had surgery fell from 31 to 24.5 by the end of their fifth year in the study .

    HYP: the average BMI among those who underwent surgery , according to a study has fallen from 31 % to 24.5 at the end of their fifth year .


  2333. REF: meanwhile , the BMI among those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatments stayed about the same at 29 .

    HYP: in the meantime , BMI were those who did not receive surgical treatment of diabetes , roughly equal to the value of 29 .


  2334. REF: among those who had surgery , diabetes resolved completely in 36 percent and partially in 28 percent .

    HYP: among patients with diabetes was resolved completely operations at 36 percent and partly in 28 cases .


  2335. REF: in the medically-treated group , by comparison , diabetes resolved completely in only 1 percent and partially in only about 2 percent .

    HYP: in the medication group was treated for diabetes resolved completely compared with only 1 percent , and only partly in about 2 percent of patients .


  2336. REF: in addition , control of blood pressure , triglycerides , and `` bad '' LDL cholesterol `` was generally better in the surgical group , '' the authors found .

    HYP: it also was the control of blood pressure , trigylceridů and `` bad '' LDL cholesterol demonstrated `` generally better in the surgical group , '' the authors found .


  2337. REF: the researchers also monitored patients ' blood levels of hemoglobin A1c , which reflect blood sugar levels over time .

    HYP: the researchers also monitored the patient hemoglobin A1c levels in the blood , which reflects the ongoing blood sugar levels in the body .


  2338. REF: hemoglobin A1c is best kept below 7 percent , the researchers write .

    HYP: it is best to maintain haemoglobin A1c below 7 percent , the researchers stated .


  2339. REF: after surgery , the average hemoglobin A1c level fell from about 9 percent to about 6 percent .

    HYP: after surgery , the average value of the haemoglobin A1c has dropped from about 9 percent to around 6 percent .


  2340. REF: in the medical therapy group , however , it remained steady at about 8 percent .

    HYP: the group treated with medication , however , this value has remained at about 8 percent .

    HYP: the research team also compared the average results with two types of operations .

    HYP: `` That got us into the knees , '' said Twins manager Paul Molitor .

    HYP: `` Did n't hit the ball very well , but he got to the right place . ''

    HYP: Hughes , who has won a number of pitches , ended up in the third inning with no points and replaced him with a righty A.J . Achter .

    HYP: Hughes ran off three runs , six hits and four strikes .

    HYP: note : Anibal Sanchez , the pitcher of the Tigers , ended the game with pain in his right shoulder .

    HYP: he 'll take care of him , Dr. James Andrews , who operated on by shoulder in 2007 .

    HYP: Sanchez , who is on the injured list because of stiff muscles in his shoulder since the middle of August , should start in Wednesday 's game .

    HYP: Sanchez will be replaced by lefty Daniel Norris , who returns from injury and goes against the Twins .

    HYP: since June 30 , when Norris was replaced by the left pitcher David Price , the score 1-1 after four games .

    HYP: from August 20 , however , still did n't play because of a strained muscle .

  2967. REF: Xi urges to open economy wider to world

    HYP: Xi calls for the opening of the economy to the wider world


  2968. REF: the economy must open wider to the outside world to fuel growth , President Xi Jinping told a group tasked with steering reform on Tuesday .

    HYP: it is necessary to open the economy to the wider world for boosting growth , said President Xi Jinping group whose mission is reform of the proceedings on Tuesday .


  2969. REF: `` China should be committed to attracting foreign investment and expertise , and improve opening-up policies , '' he said , addressing the 16th Meeting of the Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform .

    HYP: `` China should be involved in attracting foreign investment and expertise and improve an open policy , '' he said on the 16th meeting of the central leading group for deepening overall reform .


  2970. REF: promoting opening up while pushing forward reforms will add new impetus and vitality , and provide new room for economic growth , Xi said .

    HYP: promoting the opening of nascent reforms will give a new impetus and vitality , will also provide a new space for economic growth , says Xi .


  2971. REF: the leading group adopted a series of guidelines including a negative list regulating market access , relaxation of border-control policies , encouraging state-owned enterprises ( SOE ) to absorb private capital and overhauling the resident registration system .

    HYP: the group has adopted a series of directives , including the negative list of regulatory approach to the market , policy easing border controls , support for state owned enterprises ( SOE ) to absorb private capital and reorganisation of the resident registration system .


  2972. REF: according to the statement , a negative list , identifying sectors and businesses that are off-limits for investment , will be drawn up .

    HYP: the declaration states that the negative list will be developed , which identify the sectors and businesses that are off limits for investment .


  2973. REF: the system will be gradually tested and improved through trial programs .

    HYP: this system will be tested and improved through the test programs .


  2974. REF: the move is significant as it will give the market a bigger role in allocating resources , ensuring a law-based business environment and making the market more open , the statement said .

    HYP: this step is important because it will give the market a greater role in the allocation of resources , ensuring the legal business environment and make the market more open , the statement said .


  2975. REF: the government will also loosen controls on the powers it delegates to companies , making sure that companies decide how to run their businesses .

    HYP: the government also released checks on the powers that delegates firms , and make sure that the companies will decide how to run their business .


  2976. REF: the statement also said China will allow border areas to explore new models of cross-border economic cooperation and new mechanisms for promoting regional growth .

    HYP: the statement also indicated that China will allow the border areas to explore new models of international economic cooperation and new mechanisms to support regional growth .


  2977. REF: in a bid to open up state-controlled sectors , more areas will be open to private investment .

    HYP: in an effort to open the state-controlled sector will be more open to private investment .


  2978. REF: `` The government will not change its policy toward foreign investment , and will protect the lawful interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better services for them , '' said the statement .

    HYP: `` The government will not change its policy towards foreign investment and will protect the legal interests of the companies , which are financed from abroad , and will provide them with better services , '' according to the statement .


  2979. REF: in addition , it will be made easier for foreigners to apply for permanent residence permits , or `` green card , '' by optimizing requirements and streamlining the application process .

    HYP: moreover , it will be easier for foreigners to apply for permanent residence or a `` green card , '' thanks to the optimisation of the requirements and simplify the application process .


  2980. REF: guaranteeing lawyers ' right to practice and nurturing professional judges and prosecutors were also discussed at a meeting .

    HYP: ensuring the rights of lawyers to practise and develop professional judges and prosecutors were also discussed at the meeting .


  2981. REF: the meeting was also attended by Premier Li Keqiang , and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli , according to a statement released after the meeting .

    HYP: the meeting was also attended by Prime Minister Li Keqiang and leaders of Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli , according to a statement issued after the meeting .


  2982. REF: more hospital beds possible in Karlovy Vary Region

    HYP: in the Karlovy Vary region may incur new inpatient department .


  2983. REF: according to deputy governor of the Karlovy Vary Region Jakub Pánik ( ČSSD ) , the current bed capacity of two regional hospitals and two private hospitals in the region is sufficient and partial modifications should be implemented on the basis of agreements between the departments of individual hospitals .

    HYP: according to the Deputy First Minister Karlovarského kraje James Pánika ( ČSSD ) is the current capacity of the inpatient department of two regional hospitals and two private hospitals in the country is sufficient and partial adjustments should be done on the basis of an agreement between the departments of hospitals .


  2984. REF: however , in the region there are options for expanding the care offered .

    HYP: they are in the country but also the possibility of extending care .


  2985. REF: for example , single-day surgery centres for the performance of procedures not requiring hospital stays of longer than 24 hours could be set up in surgical units .

    HYP: for example , in the department of surgical units could arise day surgery center , where policies are implemented according to the performance of the surgical disciplines that do not require hospitalization for more than 24 hours .


  2986. REF: it is not yet clear in which specific hospitals single-day surgery centres could be set up .

    HYP: workplace in which specific hospitals would be aimed at the overnight surgery should be , it is not yet clear .


  2987. REF: the skin department of Karlovy Vary Hospital could see the creation of a laser centre with the option of using laser technology to treat skin disease .

    HYP: at the hospital of Karlovy Vary might be laser center , with the possibility of the use of laser technology for skin disease .


  2988. REF: the concept also recommended the setup of an apallic centre for the treatment of patients with brain disease who are in a vegetative state .

    HYP: the concept also recommended the creation of apalického centre , which would take care of patients with brain disabilities , who are in a vegetative state .


  2989. REF: such a centre would be centrally managed and should form an integral part of the Anaesthesiology and Resuscitation department .

    HYP: such a centre should be established centrally and should be an integral part of the emergency rooms and emergency department .


  2990. REF: there is also the option of concentrating such a facility at Ostrov Hospital , where a similar facility already exists .

    HYP: there is also the possibility of a concentration of such equipment to the hospital Island , where there is already a similar treatment .


  2991. REF: a further area where capacity seems insufficient are the after-care wards , and chiefly the Long-term Care Clinics ( LCC ) in Nejdek , whose capacity is insufficient and should primarily connect with acute care wards .

    HYP: another inpatient capacity , which is in the Karlovy Vary region appears to be insufficient , the subsequent care beds and especially the beds in hospitals patients ( lugs ) , whose capacity in Nejdku is inadequate and , in particular , should be closely related to acute care beds .


  2992. REF: the concept recommends that part of this facility function as a rehabilitation ward and part as a classic LCC ward .

    HYP: part of the facility would operate as a bed rehabilitation and part of a classic terminal ward beds , recommends the concept .


  2993. REF: as it notes , after-care wards are chiefly absent in Karlovy Vary Hospital ,

    HYP: as pointed out , the subsequent care beds are mainly in the hospital of Karlovy Vary .


  2994. REF: where buildings left empty following centralisation could be used .

    HYP: there could be used for the centralisation of abandoned buildings .


  2995. REF: last but not least , the Karlovy Vary Region lacks social care wards focusing on the treatment of Alzheimer 's disease .

    HYP: last but not least , in the Karlovy Vary region absentují socially medical beds , with a focus on the treatment of Alzheimer 's disease .


  2996. REF: as there is a lack of such wards across the whole country , it could also serve other regions as an 'Alzheimer centre ' .

    HYP: these beds in the country is the lack of , and therefore could be used for other regions such as the so called Alzheimercentrum .


  2997. REF: according to the recommendations , hospitals should prepare for the introduction of so-called follow-up wards that would be funded through European subsidies .

    HYP: the hospital , according to the recommendations should also prepare for the introduction of so-called downstream beds , which will be released by the financial resources of European subsidies .


  2998. REF: `` These are beds that would follow on from super-specialised medical care fields and create space for the transfer of patients following , for example , a cardiological , neurological , transplantation or other procedure , '' states the regional concept for care wards .

    HYP: `` This is a bed , which will build on the disciplines supespecializované care and will create space for the translation of patients after surgery , for example , after kardiochirurgickém , a neurosurgical , transplant or other surgery , '' describes the regional concept of inpatient care .


  2999. REF: new services could also be offered in psychiatric care .

    HYP: the new services could be offered in the field of psychiatric care .
